page.title: 14LIFE IN ST COLUMB MINOR
page.content: Mr Roberts is the owner of Treviglas Farm.The equipment used includes tractors,ploughs and other machines. His great uncle farmed here before him.The animals on the farm are dogs (to mind sheep),cats (to keep down vermin) cows and hens.Most of the land is grass which grows well in Cornwalls moist climate. Another farm called Penrose Farm is "Duchy property" meaning it belongs to the Duke of Cornwall or more usually known as the "Prince of Wales". In the future this farm may well be refurbished.Who-ever runs the house will be very lucky because it has a beautiful view down the Porth River and you can see one of the Newquay's 7 tourist beaches,called "Porth Beach" St.Columb Minor church is made of granite.The tower had fallen into disrepair and is now being rebuilt.
